item.title: The Bhutan Odyssey: The Land of the Thunder Dragon
item.description:
Beyond the Border Gate

The journey didn’t start in Bhutan. It started with the rhythmic clatter of the Delhi-Dibrugarh Rajdhani and the humid, buzzing energy of the Siliguri markets. For days, the journey was a sequence of transits—the rush of Gurgaon, the long rails through the heart of India, and the construction-heavy roads of Sevoke and Bagdogra.

item.title: Paro Chronicles: Of Sacred Cliffs and Sizzling Stones
item.description:
The Valley that Breathes

Paro doesn’t announce itself; it unfolds. We headed to the Airport Viewpoint in the crisp morning air to witness something rare. Watching a plane thread the needle between the massive peaks—landing at one of the world’s most challenging airports—felt like a metaphor for Bhutan itself: a delicate balance of modern precision and ancient geography. There is a specific kind of stillness here, even as the engines roar.
